channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Chelsea score dramatic 95th-minute winner to beat Liverpool
item.description: Moises Caicedo scores a screamer before 18-year-old Estevao Willian nets a 95th-minute winner as Chelsea beat Liverpool in a thriller at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Man Utd beat Sunderland to ease pressure on Amorim
item.description: Watch highlights as Mason Mount and Benjamin Sesko help Manchester United grab a crucial win against Sunderland, while Senne Lammens keeps a clean sheet on his debut.

item.title: Rice and Saka score as Arsenal beat West Ham
item.description: Watch highlights as Declan Rice and Bukayo Saka score to take a comfortable win for Arsenal against West Ham in Mikel Arteta's 300th game in charge.

item.title: Kudus stars for Tottenham in win over Leeds
item.description: Mohammed Kudus scores his first goal for Tottenham Hotspur in a 2-1 win against Leeds United at Elland Road.

item.title: From last-gasp winners to woes - Liverpool's late goal problem
item.description: Liverpool's remarkable run of either scoring or conceding late goals continues - and their fortune has run out, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'He's going to be special' - the moment Estevao arrived
item.description: Estevao Willian announces his arrival in English football with his first Chelsea goal - a late winner against champions Liverpool.

item.title: 'Are you Schmeichel in disguise?' Lammens serenaded on Man Utd debut
item.description: Senne Lammens was compared to Peter Schmeichel in fan chants on his Manchester United debut - but how did he really get on?

item.title: Arteta's unlucky captain - how Odegaard set unwanted record
item.description: Arsenal continue their strong start to the season with victory over West Ham - but Martin Odegaard sets an unwanted record.

item.title: 'Good on them for being excited' - should Hearts fans dare to dream of title?
item.description: Derek McInnes says Hearts fans are right to be excited after a late derby winner sends his side five points clear in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Ex-Portsmouth, Leicester and Sheffield Wednesday owner Mandaric dies
item.description: Former Portsmouth, Leicester City and Sheffield Wednesday owner Milan Mandaric dies at the age of 87.

item.title: Dribble king Kudus impresses again amid 'big expectations'
item.description: Mohammed Kudus scored and assisted in Tottenham's win over Leeds as he shows again why he is becoming Tottenham's most influential player.

item.title: Man City believe but will they win WSL this season?
item.description: Manchester City's belief has grown but are they capable of winning the Women's Super League this season?

item.title: Can Rodgers rediscover Celtic's attacking X-factor?
item.description: Celtic have a lot to work out amid an alamring downtown in scoring and form, writes Tom English.

item.title: Blackpool sack veteran boss Bruce after poor start
item.description: Blackpool sack veteran boss Steve Bruce after one year in charge after a poor start to the League One season.

item.title: Fine margins not in our favour at the moment - Slot
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says the fine margins are not in Liverpool's favour at the moment after his side conceded in the 95th minute to Chelsea at Stamford Bridge for their third loss in a row.

item.title: Diaz scores in 15 seconds as Kane breaks record in Bayern win
item.description: Luis Diaz scores twice - his first after 15 seconds - and assists Harry Kane in scoring a record 11th goal in six Bundesliga games as Bayern Munich win 3-0 at Eintracht Frankfurt to open a four-point lead at the top.

item.title: 'It had to be her!' - Kelly scores on Man City return
item.description: Chloe Kelly scores from the edge of the box to get Arsenal level against her former side Manchester City in the Women's Super League at the Joie Stadium.

item.title: Man Utd were an 'adult team' against Sunderland - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says his side were a "competitive" and "adult" team in their 2-0 win against Sunderland at Old Trafford- his 50th game in charge.

item.title: Arteta 'grateful' & 'proud' after marking 300th game with victory
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says his side dominated in their win against West Ham in the Premier League- his 300th game in charge of Arsenal.

item.title: Real Madrid want Man City's Rodri - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Manchester City midfielder Rodri is a target for Real Madrid, Manchester United defender Harry Maguire is lined up for a move to Saudi Arabia, plus more.

item.title: Can Coventry stay top? Aaron McLean's EFL takeaways
item.description: Former Peterborough, Hull and Bradford striker – and Final Score's EFL pundit – Aaron McLean sifts through some of the main talking points and gives his five takeaways from across the Championship, League One and League Two.

item.title: 'Quality' Watson 'drives' Kilmarnock - but can they keep him?
item.description: Midfielder David Watson continued his impressive early-season form with a third goal in seven league games - but can Kilmarnock keep him?

item.title: When music meets football - can you beat our lyrics quiz?
item.description: How well do you know songs including football references?

item.title: Manager almost quit football after Vigar's death
item.description: Chichester City FC boss Miles Rutherford said the late striker's family helped change his mind.

item.title: 'Double the price' - cost of watching Man Utd for fan forced to move
item.description: One Manchester United fan forced to move seats says he is paying double the price this season, and still gets soaked.

item.title: Why was Sunderland penalty overturned against Man Utd?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Sunderland's penalty against Manchester United was overturned after a video assistant referee review.

item.title: 'The club was finished' - inside Sunderland's TV drama
item.description: Former Sunderland boss Peter Reid looks back at the 1990s TV documentary series Premier Passions, documenting his side's season.

item.title: 'I like to be famous but unknown' - Ekitike in his own words
item.description: Hugo Ekitike sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss playing for Liverpool and being a private person.

item.title: Headlines from the 'Hollywood derby' - with no Hollywood
item.description: The key talking points as Wrexham and Birmingham cancel each other out without their A-lister owners in attendance.

item.title: 'World-class' Semenyo fires Bournemouth to 'unthinkable' heights
item.description: While Bournemouth stars were leaving left, right and centre in the summer, one stayed - Antoine Semenyo - and he has taken the team up to second spot.

item.title: 'Brave' Man Utd make 'statement' in Chelsea draw
item.description: Manchester United end Chelsea's 100% start to the Women's Super League season in a "statement" draw, but they were left wanting more.

item.title: 'Tuchel ends days of starstruck coaches automatically picking big names'
item.description: Thomas Tuchel's decision to ignore Jude Bellingham's desire to be in his England squad shows he will not get star treatment, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Winning goal 'unforgettable moment' for Estevao - Caballero
item.description: Chelsea assistant head coach Caballero says Estevao Willian's late winner against Liverpool is an 'unforgettable moment' for the 18-year-old.

item.title: Man City beat Arsenal to spoil Kelly return
item.description: Manchester City overcome being drawn level twice by Arsenal to seal a thrilling 3-2 win over their North London title rivals in the Women's Super League at the Joie Stadium.

item.title: Frank hails goalscorer Tel after 'setbacks' at Spurs
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank expresses his delight at seeing Mathys Tel score his first goal of the season against Leeds in a 2-1 win, overcoming the disappointment of being left out of Spurs' Champions League squad.

item.title: Nuno 'working on basics' in West Ham reset
item.description: Nuno Espirito Santo believes his side have started showing "the basics" of how he wants them to play, but the upcoming international break will be "the moment to analyse" his West Ham squad further following their 2-0 defeat to Arsenal in the Premier League at the Emirates Stadium.

item.title: 'Clumsy' Leeds unlucky in Spurs loss - Farke
item.description: Daniel Farke believes Leeds United were unlucky to have conceded two deflected goals, but that his side were clumsy in losing possession of the ball in their 2-1 defeat by Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League at Elland Road.

item.title: Le Bris trying not to be 'too negative' after Man Utd loss
item.description: Regis Le Bris says Sunderland received a "strong reminder" of the demands of the Premier League, following his side's 2-0 defeat by Manchester United at Old Trafford.

item.title: Semenyo scores twice as Bournemouth beat Fulham
item.description: Antoine Semenyo nets twice and Justin Kluivert scores a screamer as Bournemouth come from behind to beat Fulham in stormy conditions and move up to second in the Premier League table.

item.title: Sandberg stunner earns Man Utd point against Chelsea
item.description: Anna Sandberg's stunning volley secures Manchester United's second ever Women's Super League point against defending champions Chelsea in their 1-1 draw at Leigh Sports Village.

item.title: Winning title with Liverpool would be 'class' - Ekitike
item.description: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike tells Kelly Somers about his "pride" to play for the Reds and his hopes and ambitions for the future at Anfield.

item.title: Iraola full of praise for Semenyo after win over Fulham
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola is pleased and gives credit to the players' performances as two goals from Antoine Semenyo gives the Cherries a comfortable 3-1 win over Fulham at the Vitality Stadium.

item.title: El Mala strike sends Koln into Bundesliga top four
item.description: Said El Mala's superb strike gives Koln their first win in four games, a 1-0 victory at Hoffenheim which moves the visitors into the Bundesliga's top four.

item.title: Tickets, bots & touts - is Chelsea relationship with fans turning sour?
item.description: Chelsea are back in the Champions League, but relations between parts of the fanbase and the club hierarchy have turned sour.

item.title: Arsenal lead set-piece trend as NFL tactics spread
item.description: Umir Irfan looks at how football teams are using blocking moves at set-pieces in a similar way to how NFL players block their opponents.

item.title: Is Nuno the right man for West Ham?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nuno Espirito Santo might fit in as West Ham manager, based on his recent experience with Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Can set-piece coach get Newcastle's giants firing again?
item.description: Newcastle United have only scored one goal from set-plays this season and boss Eddie Howe knows his towering side have "work to do".

item.title: 'A culture to win' - how have Man City turned form around?
item.description: After the disappointing end to August, September had the potential to turn into a crisis for Manchester City and manager Pep Guardiola, but they have turned their form around.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are Kazakhstan part of Uefa?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Kazakhstan are part of Uefa.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Why was Calafiori banned from using a towel for throw-ins?
item.description: Arsenal's Riccardo Calafiori was stopped from drying the ball with a towel against Newcastle - but why did that happen?

item.title: What is meldonium and can it enhance a footballer's performance?
item.description: Meldonium use has led to significant bans for several prominent athletes.

item.title: What is the Champions League anthem?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how the Champions League anthem was created and what the lyrics are.

item.title: Is the Premier League getting younger?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks into why increasing number of teenagers and young players are playing in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Motherwell's Watt & Rangers' Martin in spotlight
item.description: In Sunday's Premiership games, there's a focus on a potential difference-maker for Motherwell at Celtic Park and a spotlight on Russell Martin, again.

item.title: How generation of cool keepers silenced trolls
item.description: The standard of female goalkeepers used to be criticised in football - but now they dominate headlines for the right reasons. What's behind their progress?

item.title: London to host inaugural Women's Champions Cup
item.description: London will host the final matches in the new Women's Champions Cup early next year, with European champions Arsenal among the four competing teams.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
